H0.text: Proton is the subatomic particle that has a negative charge.

H1.text: Neutron is the subatomic particle that has a negative charge.

H2.text: Electron is the subatomic particle that has a negative charge.

H3.text: Quark is a subatomic particle that carries a negative charge.

A4.text: Electrons have an electric charge of −1.602176634×10−19 C, which is used as a standard unit of charge for subatomic particles, and is also called the elementary charge.

A5.text: Within the limits of experimental accuracy, the electron charge is identical to the charge of a proton, but with the opposite sign.
